column4: I've tried running dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg, but I can't make my monitor use its recommended resolution (1280x720). What can I do?
It depends on your graphics card
mabel@mabel-desktop:~$ sudo lspci | grep controller
00:0d.0 VGA compatible controller: nVidia Corporation GeForce 6100 nForce 430 (rev a2)
you need to install the nvidia drivers package
Via Synaptic? Which ones is the package?
have you used the restricted drivers manager? Is your card listed there?
Now I'm using it. It's installing something.
nvida-glx-new
it would probably say something about a 3d accelerator
excellent
Yes it does.
What should I do after?
When it finishes installing, it will ask you to restart
Okay.

It will probably be alright after restarting, since (in theory) the nvidia driver will be able to detect the correct resolution of your monitor, instead of the wrong one that the vesa driver detects now
And you will probably be able to use compiz-fusion too ;-)
I thought those drivers were for 3d acceleration only.
That's cool :)
not only, the 2d part is very important because it gives you correct aspect ratio and resolution detection, and also accelerates video playback. So its better anyway ;-)
Okay. Time to restart. Will tell you later how it was.
do it a bit fast though, because I need to restart too in a minute ;-)
